subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Starbucks: The Siren's Evolution
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Starbucks: The Siren's Evolution.

hook.text: The Starbucks logo is a two-tailed siren from a 16th-century Norse woodcut. She was originally topless.

buildup.text: The founders chose a maritime theme because Seattle is a port city with coffee-shipping heritage.

discovery.text: Over four redesigns, the siren was cropped, simplified, and made less explicit with each version.

twist.text: In 2011, they removed the words entirely. The siren alone was enough â€” pure visual recognition.

climax.text: Dropping the name from a logo is the ultimate confidence: the image IS the brand.

punchline.text: When your symbol needs no words, your brand is iconic.

quiz.question: What is the figure in the Starbucks logo?
options: A two-tailed siren from Norse woodcuts
